revised_title: Muon States in Polycrystalline and Amorphous Silicon: Physics and Chemistry of Hydrogen
tldr: This article explores the physics and chemistry of hydrogen in materials, specifically focusing on muon implantation in polycrystalline and amorphous silicon. The authors demonstrate the existence of a cusp in repolarization behavior in both types of silicon and discuss the implications of these findings on the stability of muonium states and hydrogen bonding in these materials.
